Uses of Package
mgci.jhdap.shogi

  • Classes in mgci.jhdap.shogi used by mgci.jhdap.shogi 
    Class and Description
    BoardPanel
    The JPanel for the shogi board.
    Command
    This abstract class is meant to be used to deal with many different inputed text commands by using polymorphism.
    CommandLineInterface
    An experimental command line interface.
    GameState
    A class representing the state of the game at any given moment.
    GraphicUI
    The JFrame containing all of the various JComponents that make up the shogi GUI.
    Move
    A class that represents a piece move.
    Piece
    A Class representing a piece in a game of shogi.
    PlayerPane
    This class represents the info box of one player in the statistics panel present in the shogi GUI.
    PromotablePiece
    An abstract class representing a piece that can promote.
    ShogiConsole
    Experimental debug console for shogi GUI.
    StatsPanel
    The JPanel containing all of the statistics for the shogi GUI, including the move history, and the PlayerPanes with the timers and player names.
    Tile
    This class represents the position of a tile or shogi board square.
    UnpromotablePiece
    An abstract class representing a piece that cannot promote.
